intro: Macrocroton, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to various regions in Africa and is characterized by its milky sap, which is often toxic. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce showy, funnel-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, or red. Macrocroton species are often found in shrublands and open woodlands, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates. They play a role in local ecosystems, though some species are considered invasive in certain areas.
